Computers

A survey sheet on computer ownership and use was sent out to 200 homes in the village. These were delivered by 1st Harbury Guides one Monday evening.

Nearly 80% of people who replied had had a computer for more than 10 years.

Over 30% had had a computer since before 1995.

Nearly 50% of those who completed the questionnaire have more than one computer.

Email is preferred over Royal Mail by over 80% of those surveyed.

The most popular makes of computer are Dell, owned by just less than 50% of people, followed by Apple with 15%.

Computers are mostly used for communication or information; only around 30% of respondents admitting to playing games.

Only around 20% of people have bought anything on-line.

Ease of access to information, ease of communicating, photo processing and keeping records were cited as the most popular reasons for using a computer.
